channel.title: Current 2022 on rmoff's random ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Current 2022 on rmoff's random ramblings

item.title: Data Engineering in 2022: Wrangling the feedback data from Current 22 with dbt
item.description: I started my dbt journey by poking and pulling at the pre-built jaffle_shop demo running with DuckDB as its data store. Now I want to see if I can put it to use myself to wrangle the session feedback data that came in from Current 2022. I’ve analysed this already, but it struck me that a particular part of it would benefit from some tidying up - and be a good excuse to see what it’s like using dbt to do so.

item.title: Current 22 - Session Analysis with DuckDB and Jupyter Notebook
item.description: At Current 2022 the audience was given the option to submit ratings. Here’s some analysis I’ve done on the raw data. It’s interesting to poke about it, and it also gave me an excuse to try using DuckDB in a notebook!

item.title: Current 2022 - 5k Fun Run
item.description: At Current 22 a few of us will be going for an early run on Tuesday morning. Everyone is very welcome!

item.title: Inside the Sausage Factory: How we Built the Program for Current 2022
item.description:
If you’ve ever been to a conference, particularly as a speaker whose submitted a paper that may or may not have been accepted, you might wonder quite how conferences choose the talks that get accepted.

I had the privilege of chairing the program committee for Current and Kafka Summit this year and curating the final program for both. Here’s a glimpse behind the curtains of how we built the program for Current 2022. It was originally posted as a thread on Twitter.
